main.name: Erik Adames
main.description: I am a full stack software engineer with a background in Supply Chain.
main.bio:
I began my career at a local branch of Kuehne and Nagel, which is a large global shipping company, and worked full time directly after graduating college. In this role, I was able to establish a strong professional relationship with customers and become effective at developing new customers or stabilizing very demanding and complex customer accounts.  
      In 2014, I was transferred from the local Charlotte, NC office to the global headquarters in Switzerland to lead large complex pricing projects.  These projects entailed a significant amount of analysis and access to various technological platforms. Due to this, I developed a passion for combining analysis and technology which in turn led me to enroll at the Harvard Extension School to obtain a graduate certificate in data science.
      In late 2018, I married my wife who is from Switzerland and we started preparing for our eventual move to the United States. My wife started receiving great offers to work in the Bay Area so this enabled me to pursue a career in a more technology-driven occupation that builds upon my strong background in analysis. To enhance my skill set, I also enrolled at the Full Stack Web Developer bootcamp offered by University of California Berkeley which was completed in 2020.  The bootcamp provided a deep understanding of a variety of computer languages as well as the principles of data structures, algorithms and object-oriented programming. My previous work experience helped develop my dependable and superb work ethic. I am now positioned for a full-time employment opportunity and hope to hear from you soon

education.degree: Full Stack Web Developer Professional Certificate
education.description: A 24-week intensive program focused on gaining technical programming skills in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, Bootstrap, Node Js, MySQL, MongoDB, Express, NoSQL, ReactJS and Redux.
Finished the 4-course graduate level certificate with a 3.67 GPA. Relevant Coursework: Statistical Modeling, Quantitative Methods, Elements of Data Science in R, and Remote Sensing Data

education.school: University of North Carolina at Charlotte

work.company: Kuehne and Nagel Inc. - Schindellegi, Switzerland
work.title: Global Projects Pricing Analyst
work.description: Managed complex pricing projects with various distributed teams throughout the world. Ensured strict compliance with customer’s requirements, coordinated constant communication between project owners and stakeholders, resolved all conflicts between stakeholders and pricing teams, and performed a detail analysis before submitting each project.

work.company: Kuehne and Nagel Inc. - Schindellegi, Switzerland
work.title: Global Projects Pricing Analyst
work.description: Performed the day-to-day air logistics operations for Kuehne and Nagel’s Charlotte customers. Collaborated daily with customers and created standard operating procedures (SOPs) for each customer. Performed analysis of the supply chain to identify problems and implemented corrective actions.
